title: Look Down
focus: Identifying obstacles—physical, mental, and spiritual—that drag us down and fuel burnout.
description: Dig into the snares and stumbling blocks hindering your well-being and ministry effectiveness.
reflection: We all have obstacles in our lives that trip us up from time to time. As part of your journey of faith, it is essential to identify and confront the obstacles that hinder your spiritual growth. These hindrances can take many forms, such as unresolved sin, unhealthy relationships, or negative thought patterns. By acknowledging and addressing these barriers, we can free ourselves of what is holding us back so that we might experience true freedom and a deeper connection with God. This process requires honesty, humility, and a willingness to change, but the rewards are immeasurable as we move closer to the life God intends for us.
verse: Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles. And let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us. - Hebrews 12:1 (NIV)
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with open hearts, seeking Your guidance and strength. Reveal to us the things that are trapping us and hindering our spiritual growth. Grant us the courage to confront these obstacles and the wisdom to overcome them. Help us to throw off everything that entangles us and run with perseverance the race You have set before us. May Your grace and love empower us to live in freedom and draw closer to You each day. In Jesus' name, we pray. Amen.

reflectionQuestions.prompt: What physical habits or conditions (poor sleep, inactivity, illness) weigh on your energy and service?
Which thought patterns (anxiety, perfectionism, negativity) trap your mind and cloud joy?
Where do cynicism, apathy, doubt, or temptation undermine your faith and drain your spirit?
Which ministry demands or personal patterns lead you toward exhaustion rather than rest?
How does shame, guilt, or unresolved grief manifest in your body, thoughts, or prayers?

tasks.description: Choose one snare in body, mind, or spirit; create an accountability plan with a trusted peer.
List triggers for mental or emotional drain and develop a coping rhythm (rest breaks, prayer pauses).
Identify a spiritual temptation or discouragement; counter it with a chosen Scripture or practice.
Seek professional help (counselor, spiritual director) to address deeper wounds or early burnout signs.

followUpPrompts.prompt: Which snare proved most persistent, and how did you begin to interrupt it?
What changes in sleep, thought patterns, or prayer life emerged?
How will you guard against returning to that stumbling block in the coming weeks?
